instruction: Make up a poem about a violent storm.
output:
The skies darken and the wind howls,
A warning for the sorrowful souls,
The clouds rumble and the thunder dreams,
Of a violent storm on the horizon seas. 

The lightning crackles and the trees shudder,
The heavy rainfall wets all with its chatter,
The wind blows fierce and roars louder still,
Spreading terror with its will. 

The storm rages on with no reprieve,
Bringing darkness and fear to believe,
But soon it passes, the darkness gone,
Leaving beauty and joy beneath the sun.
